reviews.text: I pre-booked directly with the hotel 2 x twin rooms for 2 adults and 2 kids for 1 night. Rooms are fairly large by Japanese standards. Basic modern fitout throughout the hotel. Cleanest onsen we've come across in our travels. Onsen is on top floor overlooking the town. The front office reception staff are welcoming and professional with good English language ability. Spa Alpina seemed to appeal to foreigners. A bit highly priced so moderate value for what it is. Lacked character and seemed out of place in a small town. Spa Alpina would be awesome in a big city! I do recommend Spa Alpina but only for short stays...perhaps also try more traditional lodgings for a broader experience of Takayama.
reviews.title: Modern and super clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unless you have super-high expectations, you would love this place. After reading so many good comments from other travelers, you might expect a bit too much, I reckon. The receptionist was polite and efficient. The room was tiny but acceptable. The roof top bath was very relaxing and clean. What I like the most was the breakkie. The home-made breads were out-of-worldly. You should try that once.
reviews.title: Very good!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at several 4 and 5 star hotels throughout Japan that were mostly about two thirds of the price of the Spa Alpina, albeit without breakfast, to say that I was disappointed with this hotel would put it mildly.The breakfast was served in a room like a hostel with tightly packed formica tables, there was little room to move in the bedroom, with virtually no storage space and the bathroom was miniscule, hardly room to turn round. It was clearly cheaply constructed with no frills, again much like higher class hostels, and to charge much higher prices than excellent high class hotels, such as the Brighton in Kyoto, was a disgrace. Would definitely advise looking elsewhere
reviews.title: very poor value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must admit that we had higher expectations for the Spa Alpina than was delivered.
reviews.title: Good, but not fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the hotel is very new - yes it is well located - yes - the staff were friendly, yes - the onsen was very good. However for the price that was demanded for a smaller than average room that enjoyed a basic modular fitout I would have expected more.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: It is within walking distance and easy to find from the station. Look out the window to the right as you come into the station. It is a wonderful town. Very pretty and many sights to see. The spa is great, as is the relaxation area. Staff are helpful. The room is fresh and clean and has everything needed neatly tucked away in cupboards. I loved the fresh pyjamas every day. I had a lovely view of the sunset and the moon comes up on the other side. There are pleant of places to eat and lots of great little alleyways to explore. It would be nice to have free internet access in the foyer like in many hotels.Bikes are available to hire nearby. The free foot spas outside 2 hotels are great and the Folk Village well worth a visit. It snowed while I was there, which was lovely. Walking maps need improving for someone who thinks like an Australian.
reviews.title: Lovely spa hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff, small room. Agree with previous reviewer the bathroom was a bit odd - like a plactic capsule. Unfortunately they put us on the 8th floor, right under the Onsen, so we were disturbed by whirring machinery noises all night and early in the morning. Avoid room 812 if staying here!
reviews.title: Good value 'stopover' hotel, nice Onsen
Not awful, but not memorable INot awful but not memorable!
reviews.text: Restaurant Tip: There wasn't much open for an evening meal, especially if like us you don't eat meat. The Italian just down the road (as turn back to station) did really good food, recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a bit unimpressed with Takayama, maybe because we didn't arrive until after 4 and everything seemed a bit deserted. If I had my time again I would skip this stop-over & go straight to Shirakawa-go.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Contrary to other reviews we found this hotel decidedly average. The staff were not particularly helpful or friendly, room was very cramped even for Japanese standards (the bathroom was like a cabin on a ship). No wifi or Internet at all - not even a pay per use computer in the lobby.
reviews.title: Modern hotel close to Station with an onsen 9 floors up gazing to the Alps

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel, fantastic location. Spotlessly clean. Staff are very helpful and speak fluent English.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Literally 5mins walk from the Railway station and 5 mins from the old town of Takayama.
reviews.title: Stay here for the rooftop spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can’t fault it – very, very, good.
reviews.title: Small rooms but decent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are small (we booked a double room through Booking.com and had a small 140cm bed in a room described by the hotel as a single) - service is friendly and the hotel is bright and modern. Rooftop spa is the highlight - a great place to enjoy the Japanese onsen experience. Around 5 mins walk from station.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with rooftop spa

reviews.text: My husband and I travelled to Takayama in April. Being just the two of us, we took a semi-double. I have to say that the room is tiny! We've travelled through Japan on several occasions and so we are used to the relatively small rooms in the business hotels. However, we found the semi-double to be really shoebox tiny - and that is really saying something because my husband and I are both small, even by Asian standards!
reviews.title: Clean & Comfortable

reviews.text: The location of this modern hotel is 5 walking mins from the station and 10 mins to the heart of the old downtown.
reviews.title: Modern with onsen in convenient location

reviews.text: Rooms were generous by Japanese standards, and mattresses were hard by Western standards. We asked for an extra pillow each and they were as hard as the mattress. TV did not have any English speaking channels but that's not a big deal. There is a smoking room in the foyer, excellent Asian buffet breakfasts and fantastic onsens on the 9th floor (men and women are segrated). The staff were super friendly without being over the top, and most eager to help with any query.
reviews.title: Worth value for business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, it gets my vote.
reviews.title: Value for money, convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the travelers, you should recognize that this is business hotel. So the room will not big. The design was so simple and functional. Comfort bed and clean. Compare with another business hotel, the room is even bigger than others. Design of hotel is modern and new. I can say best business hotel in takayama.
reviews.title: Good location but very small rooms

reviews.text: Also there is a big onsen on the rooftop, both indoor and open-air. Especially open air bath made me feel so comfortable in spring times.
reviews.title: Would not recommend
